attributes.alt:
Big Chart of Big Ideas for What's the Weather? Chart shows 4 different types of weather: rainy, snowy, windy, and sunny.
Chart shows a child in a rain coat with an umbrella next to the word "rainy,"a child in a winter coat holding a snowball next to the word "snowy,"a child running with a kite in the grass next to the word "windy,"and two children building sandcastles at the beach next to the word "sunny."

elements.text: LET’s INVESTIGATE
Weather
How can weather affect us?
What’s the Weather?
Sprinkle. Drizzle. Drip. Drip. Drop.
I wonder, will it ever stop?
The clouds fill up. Then with a roar,
thunder, lightning, here comes more!
One big. One medium. One is small.
I roll and roll each snowy ball.
I know it’s cold. Why can’t I stay?
My friends and I still want to play.
The leaves rustle. The branches sway.
I fly my kite on a windy day.
It floats around from here to there.
Then flies high up into the air.
It’s early morning, before sunrise.
I can’t wait to see the bright blue skies.
We go to the beach to play in the sun,
before our vacation is all done.
